meanings.definition: To make (something) known to the public.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to publicize their new product through social media.
meanings.sent2: The local bakery will publicize their special offer in the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to publicize his disappearing act, but everyone saw how he did it.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to publicize her talent like a shining star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a megaphone to publicize the upcoming school event.

meanings.definition: To promote or advertise (something) to the general public.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity was hired to publicize the new fragrance on TV.
meanings.sent2: The charity organization aims to publicize their cause through fundraising events.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to publicize its swimming skills to the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The sun publicizes its warmth to all living creatures on Earth.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bright colors to publicize her painting at the art exhibition.
